text: László Tábori (July 6, 1931 – May 23, 2018) was a Hungarian-born American middle- and long-distance runner. He was best known for equalling the 1500 metres world record and placing 4th in that event at the 1956 Summer Olympics. Tábori was born in Košice, Hungary. He later worked as a running coach, notably working with Jacqueline Hansen, who ran two world records in the marathon. Tábori died on May 23, 2018 at a hospital in Los Angeles, California, aged 86. ==References== ==Other websites== *Laszlo Tabori's homepage Category:1931 births Category:2018 deaths Category:Olympians for Hungary Category:Olympians for the United States Category:American middle- distance runners Category:American long-distance runners Category:Naturalized citizens of the United States Category:Sportspeople from Los Angeles
title: László Tábori
